author: tersec
content:
Can I suggest, if they do a post-mortem, it has a "root cause" just ... slightly more root than:
> The underlying bug that caused this to surface was due to some false positives bringing up specific edge cases for successfully delivered blocks. This logic was modified to ignore these false positives but in the case of this builder the logic was not catching these failures properly and thus did not demote the builder automatically.

from the last episode?

(Questions about previous examples, not this, but) what false positives/what edge cases? Has this been fixed since? etc.

author: tersec
content: Or, if one wants to focus on process decisions, rather than technical details, why was the response to such edge cases "This logic was modified to ignore these false positives" rather than ensuring that the validation worked correctly?
